intro: Lobelia siphilitica f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered bluebeard, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in rich, well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. The inflorescence consists of dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
